name: Pork Shoulder
description: A Cuban-style pork shoulder (Boston butt) roast, marinated in herbs, garlic, and citrus. Yields tender, flavorful meat for 4–5 pounds of pork.
gist: Marinate pork in herbs, garlic, and citrus for 24 hours. Roast at 425°F for 30 minutes, then 375°F for 90–120 minutes.
ingredients:
4–5 lb pork shoulder
3/4 cup extra virgin olive oil
3/4 cup orange juice
1/2 cup lime juice
8 garlic cloves, smashed
1/2 tbsp dried oregano
2 tsp ground cumin
1 tsp salt
1 tsp pepper
steps:
1. Mix all ingredients together in a large Ziploc bag.
2. Marinate for 12–24 hours.
3. Remove from fridge 1 hour before cooking.
4. Ensure an oven rack is on the bottom position.
5. Preheat oven to 425°F.
6. Remove meat from marinade and wipe off large garlic chunks.
7. Place meat on an oven-safe cooling rack over an aluminum foil–lined baking sheet.
   - This allows hot air to circulate under the meat for better caramelization.
8. Bake for 30 minutes.
9. Lower oven to 375°F.
10. Roast for an additional 90–120 minutes (total ~120–150 minutes).
11. Baste with pan drippings every 30 minutes.
12. Begin checking temperature after 90 minutes.
13. After 90 minutes, check every 10–15 minutes.
14. Target final internal temperature: 160°F.
15. Example: a 4.75 lb shoulder took 110 minutes at 375°F, total 140 minutes.
16. Once done, rest on a plate lightly covered with foil.
notes: You could also cook at 320°F for ~3.5 hours for a pulled pork consistency.
